triples.name: Control theory
triples.relevance: Fundamental field providing the mathematical framework for designing control systems and policies.

triples.name: Stochastic control
triples.relevance: Provides techniques for controlling systems under uncertainty and random disturbances.

triples.name: Linear temporal logic
triples.relevance: Used to formally express complex temporal properties and specifications for the system.

triples.name: Automata theory
triples.relevance: Provides the automata representation used to decompose temporal logic specifications.

triples.name: Reachability
triples.relevance: Core problem of determining whether target states can be reached from initial states.

triples.name: Hybrid system
triples.relevance: Framework for modeling systems with both continuous and discrete dynamics.

triples.name: Vehicle dynamics
triples.relevance: Application domain for testing the control synthesis approach on lane-keeping and kinematic models.

triples.name: Discrete time and continuous time
triples.relevance: Temporal framework for modeling discrete-time stochastic control systems.

triples.name: Temporal logic
triples.relevance: Broader framework encompassing linear temporal logic for specifying temporal properties.

triples.name: Barrier certificate
triples.relevance: Control barrier certificates extend barrier certificates to solve reachability tasks and compute probability bounds.
